intro: Hieracium subgracilentipes, commonly known as the slender-stemmed hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its upright, hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Due to its delicate appearance and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
